page.title: 16THE RAILWAY LINE
page.content: It was called the Midland and South Western Railway. It ran from Andover to Andoversford in Gloucestershire. The railway was opened throughout in 1883 and closed in 1961. To start with it was a busy railway connecting the Midlands with Southampton. The line was very important in both world wars, and was used for transporting large numbers of troops and equipment. After the war fewer people used the railway because there were more cars, and goods were moved by road transport.Much of the railway line can still be seen though many of the bridges have been knocked down.Farmers use parts of the line for storing silage and the County Council use the old station for storing materials.Part of the line has been restored between Swindon and Cricklade.
